post_text: We proudly present our Lockport High School literary magazine, "Mindworks 2020," a compilation of poetry and prose written by students that you can read using this link: https://www.lockportschools.org/mindworks. Mindworks is a creative writing club where students share their written work, discuss writing techniques and strategies for both poetry and prose, and encourage each other. Students produce a literary magazine and participate in an annual literary contest. Congratulations to our 5th annual contest winners! Poetry winners 1st place: "a summer hymn" by Jessica Green (publication cover artist, artwork featured below); 2nd: "The Tusk Stretched down to the Puddled Pit" by Jeremy Stoddard; 3rd: "I Woke Up Today, the Sun Kissed My Face" by Eliza Church; and Honorable Mention: "The Rehabilitation of Arsene" by Brent Getz. Prose winners 1st place: "Suburbia" by Angelina Emmons; 2nd place "Nightwalk" by Ari Johnson; 3rd: "For Crying Out Loud" by Autumn Cercone; Honorable Mention: "They’ll Never Know" by Katherine Miner.

Romero submitted 3 digital recordings on the piccolo, flute and bassoon, completed an application, a music biography, and composed an essay, "Why I Want to be Selected for the Honors Ensemble". Students from all over the world auditioned making this a national achievement and quite an honor to have been selected. Romero will go to New York City, rehearse for 5 days with a world renowned conductor, and perform a concert on stage at Carnegie Hall.

At the end of the playoffs, the winning pair of robots were VEX teams 55055A from Lockport and 68574A from Barker. Both robotics teams will now have the opportunity to compete at the New York State championship.

post_text: Anna Merritt Wellness Wednesday: One of the most important things you can do to prevent getting sick is to wash your hands. Everyone’s hands touch so many different things each day. It is the most common way that germs are spread from one person to the next. Grocery cart handles, money, doorknobs, pens and pencils, papers, books, and toys are just some of the things that are handled by many people. Make sure to wash your hands regularly and especially after using the bathroom and before eating. Coughing on the inside of your elbow instead of on your hands also helps prevent the spread of germs.

post_text: The WNYIT (Western New York Information Technology) Conference was the first ever held at Erie County Community College, North Campus. It was a conference run by students for students. The students will be meeting with the principal and staff to develop workshops and explore opportunities for students and teachers at Lockport High School.

post_text: Anna Merritt Wellness Wednesday: Giving and receiving gifts is an age-old holiday tradition. We use it as a means of showing people in our lives that we appreciate them. Did you know that giving a gift to someone you care about has benefits to our emotional health by increasing feelings of happiness and helps us feel good about ourselves? The cost of the gift you give has no impact on receiving these benefits. Homemade gifts or offering the gift of helping someone with something they need are wonderful ways to show you care. When it comes to gift giving, it truly is the thought that counts and can benefit both the giver and receiver.
